column4: ok, so, I buggered my xorg.conf to the point where now, when I rebootk, I get an ugly weird error screen that goes nowhere. Im booting from a live cd. How can I restore a backup that I have so I can continue to mess with ubuntu?
does anyone know know how I might restore an xorg.conf file that I have backed up while using a live cd?
you would need to mount the drive, and then replace it
why are you replacing it with the live cd. Why don't you replace it in the command prompt so you won't have to mount and such
can you boot into the console (the black and white command prompt)?
after the error message, it drops me to a test line, but it's not the console. How can I boot do the console?
are you in the live cd?
ok, what is the partition that your xorg.conf is on?
open up a terminal and make the mount directory "mkdir bruenig" then mount your drive "sudo mount -t ext3 /dev/hda1 ~/bruenig"
ty, copying backup now.see you soon :) to mess it up all over again, bt, now I know how to do this so cool!
I tried save the xorg.conf, and it says it can't, becuase its a read only file. Any idea on a fix for this?
do it from the command prompt and use sudo
